requests_t module¶

requests_t.calculate_combi_score(all_results: dict, vocab_scores: list[tuple]) → list[tuple]¶
Function calculate_combi_score that calculates combi score of every vocabulary based on:

  1. SS - Similarity score

  2. QC - Query coverage

Query-Combinative-Ontology Similarity Score = SS * QC

Parameters:

  • all_results (dict(list()))

  • vocab_scores (list(tuple))

  • necesary_vocabs (list(tuple))

Returns:

new_vocab_scores (list(tuple)) - list of vocabularies with the calculated combi score.

requests_t.display_results(result: dict, name: str)¶

HELPER fucntion display_results that takes query results and displays them in a readable format

!Only used for debugging!

Parameters:

  • results (dict) – query results converted to json

  • name (str) – name of the header

  • all_results (-) – dictinary with matches for all header.

Returns:

array with typles consisting of

Return type:

  • vocab_scores (arr(tuple))

requests_t.normalize_scores(scores: tuple[str, int]) → tuple[str, int]¶

Function normalize_scores that takes list of scroes and normalizes them according to the min max formula

Parameters:

scores (tuple(int,str)) – tuple of vocabularies with corresponding scores

Returns:

tuple of voacbularies with corresponding normalized scores

Return type:

scores (tuple(int,str))

requests_t.organize_results(result: dict) → list¶

Function organize_results that converts the query result into below specified format.

Parameters:

result – retrieved matches for the header

Returns:

array with the matches data

Return type:

match_arr (arr(arr))

TARGET format:

all_results {

header1: [match(i),match(i+1),…,match(i+n)] header2: [match(i),match(i+1),…,match(i+n)]

}

Function takes care of the following part:

match(i) = [prefixedName, vocabulary.prefix, uri, type, score]

requests_t.retrieve_combiSQORE(best_vocab: str, all_results: dict) → list[tuple]¶

Funciton retrieve_homogenous that retrieves the matches based on the best vocabulary based on combiSQORE

Parameters:

best_vocab (-) – best vocabulary (see the combiSQORE function)

Returns:

array containing tuples with the following format:

(header, match_index)

Return type:

  • request_return (list(tuple))

Main logic:

  1. For every header check all the matches

  2. For every match check if it is from a best_vocab

    1. If yes add it to the list and move to the next header

  1. If the header has no matches with the best_vocab, select the first match

requests_t.retrieve_combiSQORE_recursion(all_results: dict, vocab_scores: list[tuple], num_headers: int, matched=None, unmatched=None) → list[tuple]¶

Recursive function to retrieve best matches for each header using lsit of ranked vocabularies.

Parameters:

  • all_results (-) – {header: list of matches}

  • vocab_scores (-) – (vocab_name, score), sorted descending

  • matched (-) – list of already matched (header, index) pairs

  • unmatched (-) – list of headers that still need to be matched

Returns:

list of (header, index) pairs representing best matches

Return type:

  • matched
